verses.verse: Send <S%H7971><s%> ye the lamb <S%H3733><s%> to the ruler <S%H4910><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> from Sela <S%H5554><s%> to the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, unto the mount <S%H2022><s%> of the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>.

For it shall be, that, as a wandering <S%H5074><s%> bird <S%H5775><s%> cast out <S%H7971><s%> of the nest <S%H7064><s%>, so the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%> shall be at the fords <S%H4569><s%> of Arnon <S%H769><s%>.

Take <S%H935><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%>, execute <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H6415><s%>; make <S%H7896><s%> thy shadow <S%H6738><s%> as the night <S%H3915><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the noonday <S%H6672><s%>; hide <S%H5641><s%> the outcasts <S%H5080><s%>; bewray <S%H1540><s%> not him that wandereth <S%H5074><s%>.

Let mine outcasts <S%H5080><s%> dwell <S%H1481><s%> with thee, Moab <S%H4124><s%>; be <S%H1933><s%> thou a covert <S%H5643><s%> to them from the face <S%H6440><s%> of the spoiler <S%H7703><s%>: for the extortioner <S%H4160><s%> is at an end <S%H656><s%>, the spoiler <S%H7701><s%> ceaseth <S%H3615><s%>, the oppressors <S%H7429><s%> are consumed <S%H8552><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%>.

And in mercy <S%H2617><s%> shall the throne <S%H3678><s%> be established <S%H3559><s%>: and he shall sit <S%H3427><s%> upon it in truth <S%H571><s%> in the tabernacle <S%H168><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>, judging <S%H8199><s%>, and seeking <S%H1875><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%>, and hasting <S%H4106><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%>.

¶ We have heard <S%H8085><s%> of the pride <S%H1347><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%>; he is very <S%H3966><s%> proud <S%H1341><s%>: even of his haughtiness <S%H1346><s%>, and his pride <S%H1347><s%>, and his wrath <S%H5678><s%>: but his lies <S%H907><s%> shall not be so.

Therefore shall Moab <S%H4124><s%> howl <S%H3213><s%> for Moab <S%H4124><s%>, every one shall howl <S%H3213><s%>: for the foundations <S%H808><s%> of Kir-hareseth <S%H7025><s%> shall ye mourn <S%H1897><s%>; surely they are stricken <S%H5218><s%>.

For the fields <S%H7709><s%> of Heshbon <S%H2809><s%> languish <S%H535><s%>, and the vine <S%H1612><s%> of Sibmah <S%H7643><s%>: the lords <S%H1167><s%> of the heathen <S%H1471><s%> have broken down <S%H1986><s%> the principal plants <S%H8291><s%> thereof, they are come <S%H5060><s%> even unto Jazer <S%H3270><s%>, they wandered <S%H8582><s%> through the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>: her branches <S%H7976><s%> are stretched out <S%H5203><s%>, they are gone over <S%H5674><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>.

¶ Therefore I will bewail <S%H1058><s%> with the weeping <S%H1065><s%> of Jazer <S%H3270><s%> the vine <S%H1612><s%> of Sibmah <S%H7643><s%>: I will water <S%H7301><s%> thee with my tears <S%H1832><s%>, O Heshbon <S%H2809><s%>, and Elealeh <S%H500><s%>: for the shouting <S%H1959><s%> for thy summer fruits <S%H7019><s%> and for thy harvest <S%H7105><s%> is fallen <S%H5307><s%>.

And gladness <S%H8057><s%> is taken away <S%H622><s%>, and joy <S%H1524><s%> out of the plentiful field <S%H3759><s%>; and in the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> there shall be no singing <S%H7442><s%>, neither shall there be shouting <S%H7321><s%>: the treaders <S%H1869><s%> shall tread out <S%H1869><s%> no wine <S%H3196><s%> in their presses <S%H3342><s%>; I have made their vintage shouting <S%H1959><s%> to cease <S%H7673><s%>.
Wherefore my bowels <S%H4578><s%> shall sound <S%H1993><s%> like an harp <S%H3658><s%> for Moab <S%H4124><s%>, and mine inward parts <S%H7130><s%> for Kir-haresh <S%H7025><s%>.

¶ And it shall come to pass, when it is seen <S%H7200><s%> that Moab <S%H4124><s%> is weary <S%H3811><s%> on the high place <S%H1116><s%>, that he shall come <S%H935><s%> to his sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> to pray <S%H6419><s%>; but he shall not prevail <S%H3201><s%>.
This is the word <S%H1697><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> concerning Moab <S%H4124><s%> since that time <S%H227><s%>.

But now the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Within three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, as the years <S%H8141><s%> of an hireling <S%H7916><s%>, and the glory <S%H3519><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%> shall be contemned <S%H7034><s%>, with all that great <S%H7227><s%> multitude <S%H1995><s%>; and the remnant <S%H7605><s%> shall be very <S%H4592><s%> small <S%H4213><s%> and feeble <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3524><s%>.
